info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 08 at 3:57AM PST until December 08 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT... -For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches, and winds gusting as high as 40 mph, that can cause reduced visibility due to blowing snow. -For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy wet snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 25 inches possible, with wind gusts as high as 45 mph, which could cause reduced visibility due to blowing snow. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County, including all areas along I-5 and highway 89, as well as Mt. Shasta City, Dunsmuir, and McCloud. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 10 AM this morning to 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Winter Storm Warning, 1"/hr snowfall rates are likely at 80% probability. This period is concentrated in the 1 PM to 6 PM timeframe. Heavy snow rates are also expected Friday night during the Winter Storm Watch. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. Do not detour during winter storms. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
